title: Euphaedra imitans
text:
Euphaedra imitans, the equatorial mimic forester, is a <a href="butterfly">butterfly</a> in the family <a href="Nymphalidae">Nymphalidae</a>. It is found in <a href="Nigeria">Nigeria</a>, <a href="Cameroon">Cameroon</a>, <a href="Gabon">Gabon</a>, the <a href="Republic%20of%20the%20Congo">Republic of the Congo</a>, the <a href="Democratic%20Republic%20of%20the%20Congo">Democratic Republic of the Congo</a> and western <a href="Uganda">Uganda</a>. The habitat consists of forests.
Description.
"E. imitans" Holl. is similar to "<a href="Euphaedra%20eusemoides">E. eusemoides</a>" , but the median band of the forewing is less interrupted, the forewing has several small blue spots at the base and a long yellow stripe at the hindmargin and 
the hindwing has above 3 black dots in the cell and two blue submarginal dots in each cellule. Ogowe Valley; rare and little known; much resembles "<a href="Heraclia%20%28moth%29">Xanthospilopteryx longipennis</a>" Wkr. 
It is a member of the "<a href="Euphaedra%23Species_groups">Euphaedra eusemoides</a>" species group
